main event: On December 15, 1953, in Idaho Falls, Idaho, an oval clear white object with a brighter center than others was observed. It appeared to move straight and level before disappearing.
interesting points: The reported object had a clear white center considerably brighter than surrounding lights.
Field glasses were used to make out individual lights of the object.
Although initially seen with the naked eye, the object appeared like a beam extending in a V-shape from the center.
The sighting was not correlated with any known air traffic by the clearance officer at the Hamilton Flight Service Center.
No physical evidence or photographs were provided in the report.
result: Possible aircraft lights for final approach
sighted object: Oval clear white object with a brighter center
witnesses: Captain of the guard at a chemical processing plant
